titleStmt.title: Guilielmus Wickham, Capella nus serenissimae Reginae nostrae Elizabethae.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Guilielmus Wickham, Capella nus serenissimae Reginae nostrae Elizabethae.

monogr.title: A discourse vppon vsurye : by vvaye of dialogue and oracions, for the better varietye, and more delite of all those, that shall reade thys treatise. By Thomas Wilson, doctor of the ciuill lawes, one of the masters of her maiesties honorable courte of requestes. Seene & allowed, according to the Queenes Maiesties iniunctions
monogr.author: Wilson, Thomas

div.head: Guilielmus Wickham, Capella nus serenissimae Reginae nostrae Elizabethae.
div.l: Doctus es, & pius es, Wilsone, quis abnuat istud?
Qui vel opus praesens, script due prima legat.
Nam, nisi doctrina praestante, quis obsecro posset
Rhetoricae, ac Logicae verba Britanna dare?
Et, nisi perrara pietate, quis obsecro vellet,
Ergo nisi indoctus nemo tunc illa notauit,
Nec nisi perdemens hoc reprehendit opus.
